entry.title: [Multidevice Setup] Revamp start multidevice setup UI.
entry.content:
This CL updates the UI in the start setup page inside the

multidevice setup flow. According to the mocks at

go/cros-multidevice-setup-ui-2023, this CL:



- Updates the header string.

- Removes the multidevice summary sub-text.

- Updates the footnote about feature availability.

- Updates the feature list with a new presentation/icons.

- Introduces new strings for each feature

- Updates the 'connect' button language.

- Updates line-spacing in multidevice .



This CL also:



- Updates the separator to semantic colors for correct

appearance in dark mode.

- Removes unused code to open a link from the now-removed

summary text.



Since ash/ cannot rely on Chrome/, some icons and translations

are duplicated from OS settings. We continue to use

cr-button instead of oobe-text-button for the same reason.



Some features are not flagged to appear (ie,

Instant Tethering and Wi-Fi Sync), as we do not have valid

flags for these features. Since we don't check for policy

in the other Feature flags, these features are hard-coded

to display.



Screenshots:



Before:

- Light: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5nc6mgo3TcHPSKR



After:

- Light: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/garWqHvtt3vJnCy.png

- Dark: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Boa5vDVGLM672Y8.png



Fixed: b/306657029

Bug: b/268482023

Test: Manual verification in OOBE and OS Settings.

Change-Id: I91c31b2c9154440479eda081e4a181745c9f84e8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5112920

Reviewed-by: Jon Mann

Commit-Queue: Mark Polner

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1242289}

entry.title: Convert emoji picker preferences store to non-global
entry.content:
This CL changes the emoji picker preferences store from a static class

initialised globally, to a non-static class with an instance in the app

root. This will prevent stale state carrying over between browser tests.

entry.title: [AIS] Update AppPreloadService to use AppInstallServiceAsh [4/6]
entry.content:
This CL is part of moving the WebAppInstaller into

AppInstallService as a generic installer of web apps hosted by

Almanac.



This CL updates AppPreloadService to use AppInstallServiceAsh by

moving WebAppInstaller into AppInstallServiceAsh to do the work.



The combining of install success results is now done by

AppPreloadService instead of WebAppInstaller to keep

AppInstallService's interface simple.



This is a mechanical change with no changes in behavior.



Bug: b/315077325

entry.title: [X11] Add fallback for certain XWayland compositors for WmSync
entry.content:
This is a speculative fix for bug 1510426. I'm not able to repro the

issue on any WMs I've tried, but I suspect the issue is that certain

XWayland compositors don't cooperate with our WmSync (they don't send

configure events when we request a bounds change).



This CL adds a check in Connection that WmSync will work. For

misbehaving XWayland compositors, it will fallback to syncing with

the server. This is OK because under XWayland, the server *is*

the window manager.



R=sky



Change-Id: I021fff9128ae90159aa7e584c3a969f5b7668d95

Bug: 1510426

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5138063

entry.title: Flag guard the CSD-Phishing retry mechanism and tweak when it happens
entry.content:
The CSD-Phishing retry mechanism implementation was reviewed in here

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4919285



The current logic starts the retry although the phishing detection

request has not been made. We attempt classification when the page is

captured, but we may never receive a request to classify, so there won't

be a reason to retry. We should only retry if a phishing detection

request was made from the browser process.



Bug: 1479042

Change-Id: I60dcee41791ce9ad0d28f52502e416820680483b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5159568

entry.title: Query for OpenXr Runtime status on Android startup
entry.content:
Attempts to create an XrInstance before creating an `OpenXrDevice` on

Android. This ensures that the OpenXr runtime can actually be supported

on the current device before we create the device that would attempt to

supply an OpenXr Session. This early creation of the XrInstance also

allows us to query for the supported environment blend modes at device

creation and allows us to accurately report if the device can support

a non-opaque blend mode, at which point it will take priority over

ARCore for "immersive-ar" sessions as well.



Note that initial plumbing of the service/webcontents was based on:

https://crrev.com/c/4632076



Bug: 1435548,1458584

Change-Id: Ibb8e04014c67da03cd9bab92f011901d2d88d607

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5146928

Reviewed-by: Brandon Jones

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1242227}

entry.title: VideoDecoderPipeline: drop Decode calls while resetting
entry.content:
OOPVideoDecoder has a CHECK at the beginning of its Decode() method to

make sure media::VideoDecoder::Decode() is not called if we are in the

middle of a Reset(). We have reports that this CHECK is being triggered

while playing protected content on AMD devices.



This CL aborts any Decode() calls from

VideoDecoderPipeline::OnBufferTranscrypted() if the underlying

VideoDecoderMixin is being reset. This guarantees the following

requirement mandated by the VideoDecoder::Reset() API: "All pending

Decode() requests will be finished or aborted before |closure| is

called."



Bug: 1480990

Test: manual test on skyrim

Test: media_unittests --gtest_filter=VideoDecoderPipelineTest.*

Change-Id: I1624f588d9470d613cd007a649985dbb17419486

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5116903

entry.title: Show toast on attempt to close unclosable app for window closure
entry.content:
A user may attempt to close an unclosable PWA by using the

Ctrl + Shift + w shortcut.

With this CL, ChromeOS (ash-only) will show a Toast message

indicating that the PWA cannot be closed this way. This CL also

introduces a new `OnBrowserCloseCancelled` event in the

`BrowserListObserver` to decouple the Toast implementation from

`Browser` and `BrowserList`.

entry.title: extensions/web-request: allows main frame navigations from chrome-untrusted:// to be inspected
entry.content:
This CL adds conditions so that main frame navigations initiated by

chrome-untrusted:// pages can be intercepted by WebRequests and declarativeNetRequests.



chrome-untrusted:// can window.open() and open 3P origins. These

requests aren't considered as part of chrome-untrusted:// page, and

should be inspectable (e.g. by a content filtering extension).



This CL adds browser tests to cover the behavior change for both WebRequest API and declarativeNetRequest API.

entry.title: Force stackwalk optimizations
entry.content:
Forces Breakpad's stackwalk_common library to use maximum optimizations

instead of whatever is set by GN args. The tools that use this library

are rarely debugged and enabling these optimizations can significantly

improve certain Chromium tests' runtimes.



As an example, running one of Chromium's minidump symbolization tests

with a debug build without this change takes ~700 seconds on a Linux

workstation, but only ~100 seconds with this change.



Bug: 1512608

entry.title: Add basic Picker insertion code with fake data.
entry.content:
Inserts a fake result string when clicking on the result.



Although there are two other existing places where we have similar

insertion logic, we opted to create a new class for this because:



1. The logic for Orca does not account for timeouts and relies on

global singletons.

2. The logic for the emoji picker is known to be good, but uses

"delete this" (which makes lifetimes harder to reason about) and

has hacks for counting the number of focus changes. It is unclear

whether the hacks are due to bugs or something else, but they

should be resolved at the root cause instead of relying on the

focus count which might change later.



We will follow up with the authors of the emoji picker insertion code

to make sure this logic works in all the edge cases that emoji picker

handles.



Eventually, everything should migrate to use the same logic, but it

needs to be done carefully to avoid breaking existing code.



BUG=b:316790639



Change-Id: Ib4c5912ed2cf1a8af0cbe0ab79a2a4aeac5fce15

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5161227

Reviewed-by: Michelle Chen

entry.title: Avoid inserting %c into LLVM_PROFILE_FILE if it's already there
entry.content:
The continuous mode will be enabled for coverage builds by directly

adding %c to LLVM_PROFILE_FILE in the test configs. This is necessary

because some tests don't directly invoke test_env.py. However, tests

that do use test_env.py directly may result in situations where %c is

added to LLVM_PROFILE_FILE even if it's already present, creating a

situation where the test's coverage runtime doesn't write coverage file

to the desired file. To avoid this scenario, this CL modifies

test_env.py to only insert %c to LLVM_PROFILE_FILE if it's not present.



Bug: 1468343,1462187

Change-Id: I39cff6b4c61a62c28f714e36fb583ada8029c9e9

same object. Make a copy and restore from that instead. Note that

we cannot simply assign the copy back to os.environ, as that would

replace the specialized implementation of os.environ with a standard

dict object.

entry.title: Emit histogram when attempting to open empty files from Holding Space.
entry.content:
It is unclear if this case occurs in the wild and how frequently, but

it has always been possible when attempting to open files from Holding

Space that the files be empty. With the additional of a new Photoshop

Web integration, which uses async APIs to write file contents, this is

more likely to occur.



Emit a histogram when an attempt is made to open an empty file so we

can determine if occurrence is frequent enough to warrant bespoke UX.



Note that this CL also standardizes the naming convention for item

launch related histograms.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[HoldingSpace.Item.FailureToLaunch]=Replaced by HoldingSpace.Item.Action.Launch.Failure.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[HoldingSpace.Item.FailureToLaunch.Extension]= Replaced by HoldingSpace.Item.Action.Launch.Failure.Extension.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[HoldingSpace.Item.FailureToLaunch.Reason]= Replaced by HoldingSpace.Item.Action.Launch.Failure.Reason.



Bug: b:310708275

entry.title: Don't replace os.environ with a standard dict.
entry.content:
Assigning os.environ the result of os.environ.copy() replaces it

with a standard dict. This breaks reflection into the actual

environment, as well as features such as case-insensitivity on

Windows, leading to undefined standard library behavior.



Bug: 1511316

entry.title: Revert "Webview suppress tap during fling"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5bad326c9844df90aa35c49edd3e8005869128a4.



Reason for revert: Cause test failure: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/android-pie-arm64-rel/21238/overview



Original change's description:

> Webview suppress tap during fling

>

> For apps that disables fling in webview by not calling computeScroll,

> webview still internally has a fling curve that's just not ticked. This

> caused crbug.com/514783 for those apps because tap during fling cancels

> the fling instead of registering as a tap. The old fix was to turn off

> this tap suppression during fling entirely, which causes this current

> bug where apps that allow normal fling will have tap register as a tap,

> which differs from chrome behavior.

>

> This changes so that fling is cancelled entirely for apps that do not

> call computeScroll, but keeps tap suppression behavior.

>

entry.title: Remove unnecessary workaround for unknown schemes in guests.
entry.content:
r1053172 added a workaround to keep error pages for unknown schemes

loaded within tags in the initiator's process, to avoid

crashing the browser due to an origin calculation mismatch.



This workaround is no longer necessary after r1062286 fixed the origin

computation to be more consistent in this case, in

https://crbug.com/1375945. It is better to remove the workaround at this

point, so that the error page can load in a new process and not the

initiator's process.



This change is covered by SitePerProcessWebViewTest.ErrorPageInSubframe,

which continues to pass due to r1062286. I confirmed that removing those

fixes from r1062286 along with this change causes the test to fail, as

expected.



Bug: 1366450, 1506082

Change-Id: Ib8e9b0fbf58707c59cea25459a7835603e52429f

entry.title: [FedCM] Trigger dismiss callback upon closing button flow pop-up desktop
entry.content:
Normally, the dismiss callback is called by closing the bubble widget.

However in the button flow case, no bubble widget is created so

closing the pop-up does not call the dismiss callback. We want to call

the dismiss callback so that the developer knows that the button flow

has failed as soon as possible and if the user triggers the button

flow again, there wouldn't be an error that says only one n.c.get call

is allowed at any time.



The fix for Android will be done in a follow-up patch.



Bug: 1510449

entry.title: Ensure that `chromium::import!` escaping uses an *injective* function.
entry.content:
The main change in this CL is ensuring that the escaping mechanism used

by the `chromium::import!` is "injective" (see

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injective_function). Before this CL,

different inputs could be mapped to the same output (i.e. the function

wasn't injective):



* //foo:bar_baz => foo_bar_baz

* //foo/bar:baz => foo_bar_baz

* //foo_bar:baz => foo_bar_baz



After this CL, each of the special characters (and the `_` escape

character itself) is mapped to a unique sequence of characters that

begins with the `_` escape character: `_` => `_u`, `/` => `_s`, `:` =>

`_c`, etc.:



* //foo:bar_baz => foo_cbar_ubaz

* //foo/bar:baz => foo_sbar_cbaz

* //foo_bar:baz => foo_ubar_cbaz



Other minor changes:



* Added support for escaping the `-` character (found for example in the

`//third_party/blink/renderer/platform/image-decoders` path)

* Ensured that all escaping implementations are in-sync (before this CL

`rust_static_library.gni` wouldn't take `invoker.crate_name` into

account). (Unfortunately some duplication remains and so there is

still some risk that things will get out of sync in the future.

Fixing this is hard without an ability to define reusable functions in

`.gni` files, similarly to how Bazel's Skylark allows this.)

* Removed `crate_name` from

`//build/rust/chromium_prelude:import_test_lib` and added a comment

to `rust_static_library.gni` to discourage using this property.

* Using `get_label_info(..., 'dir')` instead of inferring this

information via `target_out_dir` and hardcoded knowledge about `/obj`

subdirectory.

* Gracefully returning an error if the GN target name is not a valid

Rust identifier (e.g. the following target has a dot character inside:

`//chrome/test/chromedriver:chromedriver_server.unstripped`)

* Reverting https://crrev.com/c/4185300 under

`//build/rust/tests/test_aliased_deps` and *not* using the

`chromium::import!` macro in this test, because `aliased_deps` is

agnostic to `chromium::import!` and its mangling algorithm.



Bug: 1512174

Change-Id: I57da7ac077e82b50c6b57e25a489bc817236ed9c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5132119

Reviewed-by: Adrian Taylor

entry.title: Convert //tools/mb/PRESUBMIT.py to presubmit version 2.
entry.content:
Version 2 runs functions that start with Check as Check functions rather

than looking specifically for the functions named CheckChangeOnUpload

and CheckChangeOnCommit. The Check functions can optionally have the

OnUpload or OnCommit suffixes to limit their operation to upload or

commit, respectively. Presubmit version 2 allows for eliminating code

for combining unrelated checks just so that they can easily be enabled

for both upload and commit.



Separate checks were added for running pylint and running mb.py

validate. The CheckTests function was updated so that it would run tests

ending in _test.py and _unittest.py.

entry.title: [SamplingProfiler] Apply metadata to stack samples during frame local LCP
entry.content:
Requests that the sampling profiler apply metadata to samples during

frame local largest contentful paint. Main frame and sub frame LCPs are

put into different buckets as main frame execution is more valuable.



Note:

On Android, only around 8% navigations have cross-site sub-frame's LCP

value as final LCP. Main frame LCP should provide a reasonable estimate

on main frame execution critical path between navigation start and LCP.



As of December 2023, 50% percentile value:

- Mainframe LCP: 1107 ms

- LCP: 1135 ms

entry.title: QR codes: Stop applying input size limit to the Rust implementation.
entry.content:
Before this CL `QRCodeGenerator::kMaxInputSize` would apply to both the

old C++ implementation of the QR code generator, and to the new Rust

implementation. Uniformly applying this limit helped to ensure that A/B

experiments of the new implementation give apples-to-apples comparison.



While shipping the Rust implementation cannot be guaranteed yet (we are

still gathering data from ChromeOS experiments), it seems okay to relax

the input size limit for the Rust implementation (and this is what this

CL does). This allows users to generate QR codes for bigger URLs which

has been requested in https://crbug.com/1334066.



Fixed: 1334066

entry.title: Create helper class for "sticky" synthetic field trials
entry.content:
Given a feature flag overridden by an ordinary "base" field trial,

readaloud::SyntheticTrial registers a synthetic trial based on the

base trial and can reactivate it on subsequent startups if the base

trial name hasn't changed.



This will be useful for Read Aloud to register trials at specific times.

The immediate use case is to register the trial only after an eligible

page is loaded. This helper can allow other uses in the future, like

registering a trial only if a page has highlight/autoscroll support, for

example.



This change extracts ScopedTestMetricsService from

first_run_service_unittest.cc to be shared between tests

that need to verify synthetic trial activation.

entry.title: [Reland][Extensions] Avoid starting a worker when it is already running.
entry.content:
Reland notes: This is a reland of crrev.com/c/4868638. It contains a

speculative fix for crbug.com/1490783.



The two significant changes in the reland are:

1) ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::ShouldEnqueueTask() now does the same

running check that we do when we

ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask(). This is to avoid the

infinite loop that could be encountered when

MessageService::MaybeAddPendingLazyContextOpenChannelTask() calls

ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::ShouldEnqueueTask(). The loops occurs when

this is combined with ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask()

immediately running the

MessageService::PendingLazyContextPostMessage() callback from

MessageService::EnqueuePendingMessageForLazyBackgroundLoad()

immediately when the worker is running -- not allowing the port

channel to be created before it stack overflows.

2) It replaces ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::CanWorkerImmediatelyRunTasks()

with ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::IsServiceWorkerRunning() from

crrev.com/c/5042110. This should be a no-op.

3) The fix in ShouldEnqueueTask() breaks a web navigation test that

relies on the different behavior between service workers and event

pages. This feature fixes/change that so I've temporarily duplicated

the test for SWs until this feature is the default.



=== Original Change ===

[Extensions] Avoid starting a worker when it is already running.



This removes one case where we start a service worker in response to an

event needing to be dispatched.



Before this change we didn't check the running status of a worker and

instead would start a worker if there were no pending tasks. A worker in

blink::EmbeddedWorkerStatus::kRunning status is ready to receive events

immediately though.



This practically means that if multiple tasks built-up momentarily

before ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::DidStartWorkerForScope() finished running

we wouldn't try to start a worker. But all other times we would. For

example: taskA is dispatched and causes the worker to start. TaskB

comes into ServiceWorkerTaskQueue::AddPendingTask() a moment later after

the worker has started (when the worker is most likely still running)

and we redundantly attempt to start the worker.



After this change if the worker has

blink::EmbeddedWorkerStatus::kRunning status when TaskB arrives it will

not cause us to redundantly attempt to start the worker when it is in

this status.



This new behavior is disabled by default and will be enabled with via a

rollout due to its potential wide impact on MV3/service workers.





service_worker_context_wrapper.h, service_worker_context_core.cc, and

service_worker_context_core.h are test code.

entry.title: Broaden ownership of safe_browsing feature files
entry.content:
features.h and features.cc are a central repository for base::Features

used by safe_browsing code, but right now these files are only owned

by the top-level safe_browsing OWNERS in

//components/safe_browsing/OWNERS. This leads to code reviews where

the implementation change is fully reviewed by a more scoped owner,

but the flag definition needs another reviewer. This CL broadens

ownership of these two files to avoid needing a second reviewer.

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Refactor Pane structure
entry.content:
Create TabSwitcherPaneAdapter to adapt the TabSwitcherPane to the old

TabSwitcher interface. Once Hub is launched we can deprecate or shrink

the TabSwitcher interface significantly.



Reorganize the TabSwitcherPane and TabSwitcherPaneBase code to use a

factory for creating a TabSwitcherPaneCoordinator (which will replace

TabSwitcherCoordinator).



With this implementation the TabSwitcher and TabSwitcherPane are created

one time when the pane is first shown and are destroyed along with the

activity. However, we can independently create and tear down the

TabSwitcherPaneCoordinator saving resources when the tab switcher is not

visible.



and tested later or that assert false.

entry.title: FLEDGE: Try to reduce network debug event flakiness
entry.content:
... particularly around reportWin() worklet. We forwarded the events

via AuctionURLLoaderFactoryProxy, but that gets destroyed basically

immediately after reportWin finishes, so it's easy for debug event on

an unrelated pipe to get dropped. This change splits out the handling

of that to a separate object, with a longer lifetime, which hopefully is

enough to get it through reliably. (But might not be since what

owns AuctionURLLoaderFactoryProxy is the WorkletOwner, so if it's going

away we're going to ask the worklet process to exit, too).



Bug: 1498414

entry.title: Print preview: Fix regression hiding available printers
entry.content:
This change fixes a regression introduced by the Printer Setup

Assistance which only shows a throbber even if there are printers

available to select. This happens if it's still searching for additional

printers.



- Changes the destination list showing to be based on if any

destinations are available

- Now that the destination list shows while still searching, add logic

to hide the destinations list's throbber

- Moves resizing the destination list area to after destinations update

entry.title: Fix blank mini player.
entry.content:
Setting button controls doesn't always trigger an animation, which in turns triggers fading in of the mini player controls. Detect such cases and force fade in. UI transitions are not as smooth as when we animate bottom controls, but I didn't find how to force bottom controls animations, so at least this hack is limited to our own code.

entry.title: [TLDD] Fix for drop onto compositorViewHolder.
entry.content:
Dropping onto web content was working before and stopped since CL [1] landed. We were not using text/* mimetype before but added this in the below CL to support drag to open new instance of Chrome. Since EventForwarder relies on this mimetype, it was catching the dragevents and returning true. They were not getting passed on to CVH drag listener [2].



Updated to exclude browser drags from going through EventForwarder listener.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5134786

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/dragdrop/ChromeTabbedOnDragListener.java



Fixed: 1514550

entry.title: Add first iteration of SidePanelModel
entry.content:
This adds SidePanelModel and a SidePanelModelHost. A builder is added to

DialogModelSection to be able to construct multiple DialogModelSections

easily as "cards" within the side panel.



A prototype call site is added to performance controls, but is never

executed. This will let us iterate on styling.



To host a DialogModelSection outside of BubbleDialogModelHost a

DialogModelSectionHost is added, which effectively currently hides

implementation details of BubbleDialogModelHostContentsView which

BubbleDialogModelHost isn't ready to stop depending on.

entry.title: [fre-on-flex] Improve branding-dependent tests for auto enrollment
entry.content:
The current tests only run when is_chrome_branded is true during the

build (which turns into BUILDFLAG(IS_CHROME_BRANDING) being true),

and are disabled when not. This is done through macro definitions that

also make the code not very readable there.



Change the tests so that they check enablement of features against

the is_chrome_branded_ constexpr that itself is dependent on the build

flag.



In addition to increased readability, this also improves code coverage

by testing that we don't accidentally enable things when the build is

not Google branded.



Bug: b:314427387

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter='AutoEnrollmentTypeChecker*'
